alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Kemper; Lauderdale (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 6:03PM CDT until March 26 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN KEMPER...NORTHEASTERN CLARKE AND EASTERN LAUDERDALE COUNTIES... At 603 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Increase, or 14 miles southeast of Meridian, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Alamucha around 620 PM CDT. Toomsuba around 625 PM CDT. Kewanee around 630 PM CDT. Lauderdale around 640 PM CDT. Tamola around 650 PM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for east central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
